effect: Direct write 8-bit DAC
comments: Data is 8-bit unsigned format.

effect: Direct write 16-bit DAC
comments: Data is 16-bit unsigned format, first low byte then high byte.

effect: Start normal mode DMA for 8-bit DAC transfer
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first. Stereo DAC transfer if stereo flag is set in Mixer register 0Eh. Maximum sample rate is 44 kHz mono, 22 kHz stereo.

effect: Start normal mode DMA for 16-bit DAC transfer
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first. Stereo DAC transfer if stereo flag is set in Mixer register 0EH. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz mono, 11 kHz stereo.

effect: Start auto-initialize mode DMA for 8-bit DAC transfer
comments: Block size must be previously set by command 48h. Stereo DAC transfer if stereo flag is set in Mixer register 0Eh. Maximum sample rate is 44 kHz mono, 22 kHz stereo.

effect: Start auto-initialize mode DMA for 16-bit DAC transfer
comments: Block size must be previously set by command 48h. Stereo DAC transfer if stereo flag is set in Mixer register 0Eh. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz mono, 11 kHz stereo.

effect: Direct mode 8-bit ADC
comments: Data is 8-bit unsigned. Firmware controlled input volume for AGC.

effect: Direct mode 16-bit ADC
comments: Returns least byte first. Data is 16-bit unsigned format. Input volume controlled by command DDh.

effect: Start normal mode DMA for 8-bit ADC transfer
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first. Firmware controlled input volume for AGC. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz: use command 99h for higher rates up to 44 kHz.

effect: Start normal mode DMA for 16-bit ADC transfer
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first. Input volume controlled via command DDh. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz.

effect: Start auto-initialize mode DMA for 8 bit ADC transfer
comments: Block size must be previously set by command 48h. Firmware controlled input volume for AGC. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz: use command 98h for higher rates up to 44 kHz.

effect: Start auto-initialize mode DMA for 16-bit ADC transfer
comments: Block size must be previously set by command 48h. Input volume is controlled by command DDh. Maximum sample rate is 22 kHz.

effect: Set time constant
comments: Set time constant, X, for timer used for DMA mode DAC/ADC transfers: rate = 1 MHz / (256-X) X must be less than or equal to 233. For stereo DAC, program sample rate for twice the per-channel rate.

effect: Alternate set time constant
comments: Alternate set time constant, X: rate = 1.5 MHz / (256-X)\n\nThis command provides more accurate timing for certain rates such as 22,050. X must be less than equal to 222. For stereo DAC, program sample rate for twice the per-channel rate.

effect: Set filter clock independently of timer rate
comments: Set filter clock independently of timer rate. (note that the filter clock is automatically set by commands 40h/41h) Filter clock rate: rate = 7.16E6 / (256-X)\n\nThe relationship between the low-pass filter -3 dB point and the filter clock rate is approximately 1:82.

effect: Set block size
comments: Set block size-1 for high speed mode and auto-init mode transfer, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 4.3-bit (low compression) format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 4.3-bit (low compression) format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 3.4-bit (medium compression) format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 3.4-bit (medium compression) format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 2.5-bit (high compression) format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 2.5-bit (high compression) format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 4.3-bit (low compression) format ADC, compression, and DMA transfer
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ESPCM® 4.3-bit (low compression) format ADC, compression, and DMA transfer with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ADPCM 4-bit format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ADPCM 4-bit format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ADPCM 2.6-bit format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ADPCM 2.6-bit format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.

effect: Start ADPCM 2-bit format DMA transfer to DAC
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.\nFIXME: Verify on real hardware, this should be Sound Blaster auto-init 2.6/4-bit ADPCM. May be error.

effect: Start ADPCM 2-bit format DMA transfer to DAC with reference byte
comments: Data is transfer count - 1, least byte first.\nFIXME: Verify on real hardware, this should be Sound Blaster auto-init 2.6/4-bit ADPCM. May be error.

effect: Generate silence period
comments: Data is number of samples - 1.

effect: Start auto-initialize DMA 8-bit transfer to DAC
comments: Transfer count must be previously set by command 48h.

effect: Start DMA 8-bit transfer to DAC
comments: Transfer count must be previously set by command 48h.

effect: Start high speed mode, auto-initialize, DMA 8-bit transfer from ADC
comments: Transfer count must be previously set by command 48h. There is no AGC. Input volume is controlled with command DDh. Maximum sample rate is 44 kHz.

effect: Start high speed mode, DMA 8-bit transfer from ADC
comments: Transfer count must be previously set by command 48h. There is no AGC. Input volume is controlled with command DDh. Maximum sample rate is 44 kHz.

effect: Resume after suspend
Enable ES1868 Extension commands Axh, Bxh. Must be issued after every reset.
Disable ES1868 Extension commands Axh, Bxh.
Read GPO0/1 Power Management register
Write GPO/1 Power Management register
Pause DMA
comments: Internal FIFO operations will continue until the FIFO is empty (DAC transfer) or full (ADC transfer). It is not necessary to use this command to stop DMA if the transfer is completed normally and the end-of-DMA interrupt is generated.

effect: Enable voice DAC input to mixer.
Disable voice DAC input to mixer.
Continue DMA after command D0h.
ESS488 command compatibility
comments: For compatibility with the ES488, always returns “1”.

effect: ESS488 command compatibility
comments: ES488 command not supported by ES1868. Use mixer registers instead.

effect: ESS488 command compatibility
comments: ES488 command not supported by ES1868. Use mixer registers instead.

effect: Return voice DAC enable status
comments: 0=disabled 0xFF=enabled

effect: Return current input gain, 0-15, (valid during 16-bit ADC and 8-bit “high speed mode” ADC).
Write current input gain, 0-15, (valid during 16-bit ADC and 8-bit “high speed mode” ADC).
ESS488 command compatibility
comments: ES488 command not supported by ES1868. Use mixer registers instead.

effect: ESS488 command compatibility
comments: ES488 command not supported by ES1868. Use mixer registers instead.

effect: Return version number high
comments: ESS1868: high (3), followed by version number low (1). This indicates Sound Blaster Pro compatibility.

effect: ES1868 Identification bytes
comments: Returns ES1868 Identification bytes: 68h 8xh, where x is the version code. Sound cards not using an ES1868 will either ignore this command or perform an unknown function, in which case the sound card should be reset after this command is used. The version code, x, is less than 8 for the ES688, and greater than or equal to 8 for the ES1868.

effect: Generate an interrupt for test purposes
Force power-down
comments: Forces power-down. Software or hardware reset. Required for wake-up.
